programme.title: The Cheyenne Social Club
programme.desc: Two cowboys (James Stewart, Henry Fonda) ride from Texas to Wyoming to claim an inheritance which turns out to be a brothel.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill saves a government agent from an ambush; the agent is carrying a list of landowners who are refusing to pay their taxes, and Bill learns the daughter of one of those landowners arranged the ambush.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill finds a town engulfed in a feud between two ranchers; he also learns that his former commanding officer is now a doctor who's turned to drinking, and a young man blames him for crippling his arm.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: A lynch mob wants to hang a young man convicted of killing a family of homesteaders; Bill rides in with a stay of execution from the governor just as the mob is about to break into the jail; the desperate prisoner escapes.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill stops to visit his friend, a well-respected sheriff, only to find that the whole town has turned against him and he's been jailed for killing an unarmed kid; Bill seeks to discover the real truth.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill comes to the defense of an unassuming man who is being bullied and tries to encourage him to stand up for himself; soon after, the man asks Bill to teach him how to use a gun.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill takes the job of escorting a convicted killer to his hanging, knowing that the man's sons and gang members are planning to free him.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: An Easterner and his daughter hire Bill to guide them searching for a wild stallion to breed; however, an old enemy plans to follow them and rob the horse breeder to get revenge on Bill.

programme.title: Rage at Dawn
programme.desc: A special agent (Randolph Scott) poses as a train robber to infiltrate Frank Reno's (Forrest Tucker) outlaw gang.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: A series of deadly bank robberies involves a mysterious old lady.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy sets out to catch a chronic breaker of saloon windows.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy protects a professor and his daughter from claim jumpers.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy tracks a counterfeiting ring.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Someone tries to kill California Carlson and his kin during the reading of a will.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: A bank robbery ruins Hoppy's holiday in Mesa City.

programme.title: Gunfighters of Abilene
programme.desc: A gunslinger (Buster Crabbe) goes after the land baron (Barton MacLane) who framed and killed his brother.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Frankie go to Kansas City to aid in the capture of outlaw brothers Frank and Jesse James.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: When the Apache chief leads a raid on a train depot, looking for weapons and provisions, one of his braves is captured.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Despite their position under cover as members of the infamous Quantrill gang, Matt and Frankie cannot stop them from carrying out a vicious massacre in Lawrence, Kan.; Matt sets out to hunt down Quantrill for what happened.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Frankie investigate a woman's suspicious cattle ranch amid a crisis threatening competing ranches in Sweetwater, Wyo.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt investigates the deaths of two Osage Indians.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: The 1850s California gold fields is home to notorious bandit Joaquin Murietta; Matt and Frankie arrive to track him down but he kidnaps Frankie; Matt and Captain Love trail Murietta to the bitter end.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Tiburcio Vasquez vows vengeance against Anglos after his sister Dolores is killed; Matt and Frankie try to stop his years of terror in Southern California after a railroad agent is killed with the help of local priest.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt enlists the aid of Dakota chiefs to bring in Crazy Horse.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Frankie poses as a gang member's wife but gets caught.

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: A man in black (Yul Brynner) recruits six hired guns to lead Mexican villagers against the gang of an outlaw (Eli Wallach).

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Yancy wins two tickets to Promontory, Utah, to attend the linking of the transcontinental railroad.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Charged with cleaning up the notorious Gallatin Street, Yancy Derringer finds himself once again at odds with Toby Cook, owner of the Jumping Jack Casino.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Hoss and Little Joe spend a most unforgettable night at the carnival when Little Joe's date disappears.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: A sheriff's daughter runs off with her boyfriend (John Ericson), unaware he is a murderous bank robber.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Ben gives farmland on the Ponderosa to an outcast Indian (Ricardo Montalban) who saved his life; guest Madlyn Rhue.

programme.title: Tension at Table Rock
programme.desc: An outlaw (Richard Egan) on the run helps a sheriff (Cameron Mitchell) keep order in a town overrun by cowboys.
